lessons.phrase_native: 그 긴 밤이 널 따라 흘러만 가는 것 같아
lessons.phrase_translation: The long night is following you as it flows
lessons.context: This phrase reflects the poetic and emotional language often used in K-pop to describe the feeling of time dragging when dealing with heartbreak. In Korean culture, time is often personified in literature and music to express emotional experiences.
lessons.fill_in_blank: 그 긴 밤이 널 ______ 흘러만 가는 것 같아.
lessons.fill_in_blank_translation: The long night is ______ following you as it flows.
scenario_options_native: 그 긴 밤이 널 따라 흘러만 가는 것 같아.
scenario_options_translation: The long night followed you as it flowed.
I was just a bit tired.
I don’t know, I slept well.
lessons.correct_option: 그 긴 밤이 널 따라 흘러만 가는 것 같아.

lessons.context: In Korean ballads and K-pop, love is often depicted as bittersweet, with love and pain deeply intertwined. This lyric reflects the emotional weight that is commonly expressed in Korean love songs.
lessons.scenario_question_translation: What do you think about love?
scenario_options_translation: I think love is so painful.
I think love is always happy.
I don’t know, I don’t have much experience.

lessons.phrase_native: 왜 멀어져가 왜 닿지 않을 만큼 가서
lessons.phrase_translation: Why are you getting farther away, so far that I can’t reach you?
lessons.context: In Korean culture, emotional distance is often described as physical distance. The use of distance as a metaphor for relationships and emotional disconnection is common in K-pop.
lessons.fill_in_blank: 왜 ______ 가 왜 닿지 않을 만큼 가서.
lessons.fill_in_blank_translation: Why are you ______ so far that I can’t reach you?
lessons.scenario_question_native: 요즘 왜 나한테 멀어지는 것 같아?
lessons.scenario_question_translation: Why do you seem distant these days?
scenario_options_native: 왜 멀어져가, 닿지 않을 만큼 멀어졌어?
scenario_options_translation: Why are you getting so far away, so far I can’t reach you?
lessons.correct_option: 왜 멀어져가, 닿지 않을 만큼 멀어졌어?

lessons.phrase_translation: I always smile in front of you
lessons.context: In Korean society, maintaining a 'smiling face' is often a way of concealing deeper emotions. This lyric captures the idea of hiding one’s pain behind a smile.
lessons.fill_in_blank_translation: I always smile in front of ______.
scenario_options_translation: I always smile in front of you.

lessons.phrase_native: 이별이란 아프고 더 아픈 것 같애
lessons.context: In Korean culture, parting ways or '이별' (farewell) is considered one of the most difficult aspects of relationships. It is often seen as a deeply painful experience that stays with you long after.
lessons.fill_in_blank_translation: Goodbyes are ______ and even more painful.
scenario_options_native: 이별이란 아프고 더 아픈 것 같애.
scenario_options_translation: Goodbyes are so painful, even more painful.
lessons.correct_option: 이별이란 아프고 더 아픈 것 같애.
